titleproper.value: Guide to the William Zinsser Papers <lb/><date>ca. 1946-1998 </date><lb/> <num>MSS 031</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Katherine Harris, June-November 1998

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-02-14T21:44:28</date>

extent.value: in 11 record cartons, 1 half manuscript box and 1 oversize flat box.

abstract.value: William Zinsser's papers include correspondence, manuscripts, scrapbooks, reviews and teaching materials relating to his career as a writer, editor, and educator.

p.value: Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

Published citations should take the
following form:<lb/><lb/>
Identification of item,  date (if known); William Zinsser Papers; MSS 31; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

<chronlist><chronitem><date>1922-1943</date><event>Born in New York City, 1922. Princeton University, class of 1944.</event></chronitem><chronitem><date>1943-1945</date><event>Enlisted in the U.S. Army (North Africa and Italy).</event></chronitem><chronitem><date>1946-1959</date><eventgrp><event><title render="italic">New York Herald Tribune</title>:</event><event>Feature writer, 1947-1948</event><event>Drama editor (in charge of Sunday section of theater, movies, music, dance, art, etc.) 1949-1954</event><event>Chief movie critic, 1955-1958</event><event>Editorial writer, 1958-1959</event></eventgrp></chronitem><chronitem><date>1959-1972</date><eventgrp><event>Free-lance writer of magazine articles, books and other projects. </event><event>Columnist for <title render="italic">Look</title>, 1967</event><event>Columnist for <title render="italic">Life</title>, 1968-1972</event></eventgrp></chronitem><chronitem><date>1970-1979</date><eventgrp><event>Yale University.</event><event>Teacher of nonfiction writing, 1970-1979</event><event>Editor, <title render="italic">Yale Alumni Magazine</title>, 1970-1977</event><event>Master of Branford College, 1973-1979</event></eventgrp></chronitem><chronitem><date>1977</date><event>Columnist for the <title render="italic">New York Times</title>, Home Section, March-September.</event></chronitem><chronitem><date>1979-1987</date><eventgrp><event>Book-of-the-Month Club.</event><event>Executive Editor in charge of in-house publications. Also responsible for the club’s educational and public service activities (public lectures, exhibits, etc.).</event></eventgrp></chronitem><chronitem><date>1976</date><event>Lecturer, teacher and consultant on writing to colleges, schools, school systems, newspapers, magazines, businesses, etc.</event></chronitem><chronitem><date>1987</date><event> Free-lance writer of magazines and books. Fifteen books published altogether.</event></chronitem><chronitem><date>1988-present </date><event> Teacher of writing at the New School.</event></chronitem></chronlist>

<list><item>Subseries A contains lecture notes, letters, and articles from his academic teaching at Yale University (1971-1978), his editorship at <title render="italic">Yale Alumni Magazine</title> (1970-1977), his Mastership at Branford College (1973-1979), and his teaching at The Fieldston School (1998). The letters from former writing students, which were solicited by Mark Singer in honor of <title render="italic">On Writing Well</title>'s 6th edition, are also included. This subseries is arranged chronologically.</item><item>Subseries B contains lecture notes, workshop requests, and articles from William Zinsser's talks and workshops given 1976-1998 throughout the United States on writing. This subseries is arranged chronologically.</item></list>

subject.value: English language |x Rhetoric |x Study and teaching.
